intro: Amsinckia oxycarpa, commonly known as the desert paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant has a taproot system that allows it to survive in arid and sandy environments. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to violet, bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
